resources.string: An Ash Tree in poor health has poor shape and color in the fall, and also fails to provide shade
Bark splitting and woodpecker damage are both symptoms of EAB infestation
A healthy Ash Tree has a full canopy and no bark damage
The Beetle is Metallic Green in color and approximately 1/2 inch long.
When visible, the larvae is cream colored, slightly flattened and have pincer like appendages at the end of their abdomen.
D-Shaped Exit Holes - D shaped exit hole approx 1/8 in diameter.
S-Shaped Larval Gallery - serpentine shaped galleries packed with frass (larvae poop) and sawdust.
